> [ass](#comment_3_19z3VucxwAoyQZwhmjEgA6vJ9TTp2GmGLN): Thanks!"LetsRaceBwoi" is my username on multiple websites (Twitch, Twitter, some forums) and therefore I took "Bwoi" from the name and decided to use it as a name for a search engine.
> 
> I'm working on it! Currently we have the largest index anyway, so I should work on compressing it somewhat too.

Interesting! Nonetheless, I was using Bwoi a bit and seemed to be getting some duplicate results, torrent.zerolimits is one example - so the index should probably be cleared, as that might be distracting/annoying to some users. Otherwise, good job and keep it up!

> [ass](#comment_5_19z3VucxwAoyQZwhmjEgA6vJ9TTp2GmGLN): Thanks man! :)

Great, love the spirit here :)

> [bwoi](#comment_2_1F1kDrT693w8ATbcXV1wHmGSD6SpSY4f5L): I'm going to be introducing other services (video, chat) to Bwoi soon, as well, as soon as I finish coding them :)

Woohoo, interesting things coming up! Nice to know that Bwoi will make a move into it's own direction. Good features! How very google-like of you ;)

> [pycole](#comment_15_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): Protip: zeronet doesn't work terribly well with large files just yet.

Thanks for the "protip", pycole ;)
I'm aware of that, this should serve the purpose of getting a feeling for how big a file can be to be served properly exclusively via ZeroNet. I'll do some transcoding and get the file size down, hopefully soon we can find the sweet spot.

Just replaced the 130 MB .mp4 with a ~30 MB .m4v version.
The quality is quite awful, but I hope that will do its part for usability. 
I think I fixed the bugs, I was sloppy when hacking that together, just wanted to see how well it would work out and didn't think about anything that could go wrong.

> [eibriel](#comment_5_1BYU9zV786auJ29dF3HMAQYhxA2WgN4ofi): Nice work!

> [pycole](#comment_23_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): Well, the whole thing downloads for me. Guest we can at least handle files up to 28mb. Cool.Torrent-like transfers will make this a whole lot easier, though that feature seems to be further down the road.
> Hmm...Anyone good with DHT?

Thanks for the feedback, pycole.
Good to see that it seems to be working so far, hopefully the file splitting as in torrents will come sooner rather than later - that would really allow for huge steps forward.
Unfortunately, I'm completely new to it - otherwise I would give it a try.
